p: The results of MIC and MBC tests are indicated in Table 2. In agreement with the DDA and WDA findings, the growth of L. innocua was suppressed to a greater extent than the other microorganism. The antibacterial effect of the CLEO could be due to the presence of limonene (as the main chemical constituent) and phenolic compounds in the oil, which their antibacterial activity has been reported in some studies (Dholwani et al., 2008; Han et al., 2020; Liu et al., 2020).
